reviews.sentence: 2nd stay as good as the first. This was my 2nd stay at this Hilton and I will say that it is one of the better Hiltons in the system. We checked in late and the staff was absolutely great friendly cheerful and efficient. The hotel facility is great with a huge beautiful lobby nice bar and comfortable clean rooms. I will say that I was just a little disappointed in the breakfast in the executive lounge. The space seems a bit too small for the size of the hotel and was quite crowded. Otherwise everything was great. I would not hesitate to book another stay and would easily recommend this hotel to others.

North Houston Is Outstanding. The Hilton at Grenspoint is conveniently located to all of North Houston. It has each access via automobile and the staff is top flight. The accommodations are excellent and if you choose not to dine at the hotel the location has plenty of selection for food choices within 10 minutes drive. Great place to stay.

Pretty nice hotel. Great hotel stayed for business with no car mall across the street sort of sketchy area stick to driving or walking during the day. Room was beautiful with an awesome bed set up like a suite bar sink but no fridge lobby and restaurant lovely.

The hotel is fine. Very nice lobby and clean rooms. The area however is not the greatest. The mall across the street is in decline and a lot of shady looking people tend to loiter there. If you are in town for business it is fine. But if you want to get out of the hotel a car is advised.

Gross. I was on a quick business trip and needed a place to stay Hilton is normally a reliable brand. Lobby was nice and people were friendly. Then came the room. Gross brown water from the taps very dirty bathroom with other peoples hair and stains and a bad smell that I could not quite place. It was only one night so I did not make a fuss but I would never go there again.

Seek out Shay at the check in desk she will make you instantly feel genuinely welcome and happy to be there. There always seems to something going on in the cavernous and beautiful atrium style lobby. I love this place and stay here at least once a month.

Friendly staff nice decor clean polside area was very nice amenities etc. Overall it was a beautiful hotel and I love nice hotels. I was shocked when I entered the building. In order to access WiFi you had to go downstairs in the lobby area.

Very welcoming and helpful. Vileyka and Tabitha were both very warm and helpful in welcoming us. I was quickly provided with the information and resources that i asked for. They offered me a tooth brush a comb toothpaste wifi info etc. Beautiful staff and facility. Thank you.

Houston. A very enjoyable stay. Prompt pick up service from Airport and beautiful Lobby. The place was buzzing with a party gathering in the lobby. The room was spacious and clean. No noise problems. Up early and took advantage of well maintained Fitness room.

Unexpected Stay. We stayed here unexpectedly when our international flight was cancelled leaving us without luggage for the night. The staff at the hotel were exceptional in offering us some necessities like a toothbrush upon check in. Diego the concierge and Joseph the shuttle driver even took me to a nearby Walmart where additional items could be purchased. The staff at this hotel are compassionate and kind.

1. Customer service is excellent. 2. The rooms were spacious but outdated and our room did not have hot water. We were immediately switched to an upgraded room and the water was hit in the tub but not the sink. 3. The Starbucks opens early onsite which is great. 4. You can hear some construction sounds in the day time as the hotel is being renovated. 4. The rooms have must smelly like soggy cheesy fries and basement. 5. The heat takes a long while to kick in but it does work. 6. This location does have a shuttle to the airport that runs every thirty mins from 5am1am. Had to come back to add to review the new rooms thermostat stopped functioning. Hotel staff was on it and very accommodating. Unfortunately the thermostat broke 3x and the staff moved us to our 3rd room where water still never really got hot. Also the construction sounds were way too loud all day and even the lobby was covered in dust and interrupted lunch service. If it was not for the amazing customer service I would give a poor review. Looking forward to renovations being complete but you may want to choose a different hotel until renovations are complete. We were in 3 different floors on various sides of the hotel and the noise was outstanding. Also food was good at buffet and room service were delish. Fish tacos and salmon a d potatoes were very good. Airport shuttle service was good. Shuttle left promptly a d driver was great. Grab an earlier shuttle as the shuttle makes a stop to Mariot as well. You get dropped of right at your gate.

This hotel is in need of upgrades. The elevators are slow at breakfast the egg cooker was missing and they had no eggs in the buffet. Now I have put in two calls for towels and still have none. will not stay here again.

I am sure the Hotel will glorious after the renovations. The lobby was pretty. Under construction but they did a nice job camouflaging the construction. Starbucks on location was a huge bonus. The room was very clean. I like the layout of our king suite. Shower water was scalding hot no cold water. Impossible to take a shower. I was told I was supposed to let the water run to get cold water strangest advice to get cold water. For Hilton I was surprised there was a lot of wear of the tub and the lobby furniture.

Needs Work. I am incredibly dissatisfied. 1. Prior to my arrival I was offered a free upgrade. This was a trick to move me out of a room with double beds into one with a single king. My room was not any different from anyone elses. 2I was put on a floor where the hotel was under construction. The noise was unbearable. 3 Housekeeping did not clean my room on the first day of my stay I had to call and remind them. They finally cleaned it at night. 4. The in room safe did not work. 5. On the day of our departure the elevators were down. My daughter with a freshly sprained ankle had to walk up and down nine flights of stairs for breakfast and then to load the car.

Fantastic People. I have stayed at this property several times over the past few months. The service is fantastic. Despite the on going renovation the older rooms are still respectable. Kudos to my favorite people at the front desk Cheryl Amber Delaya Blanca Benita at breakfast Patty Jose Maria at Vinos Selso and the other 3 staff members whose names are escaping me. Consistently excellent serviceYes the property is undergoing renovation. The morning before I arrived I was alerted that the water would be off until morning and that I could cancel without penalty. I did not change my reservation and was grateful for the advance notice. I have stayed on several different floors where rooms were undergoing renovation at the other end. I never noticed noise. One time I could smell paint when I exited the elevator but once in my room no problem. My rooms have always been clean. I have not yet stayed on a newly renovated floor but hear good progress has been madeI am thrilled that Vinos food menu has expanded since my first stay. In the morning the breakfast buffet is consistently quite nice with the option for cook to order omelets. I do not know the variations in pricing because I use the my way benefit as a Diamond memberI appreciate security in the hotel parking lot as I see at many hotels and restaurants in Houston. Despite arriving near midnight or leaving before 6 am I have never felt unsafe. Parking is free with plenty of spaces. The only downside is most of the nearby restaurants are closed in the evening. Papas Seafood is a short drive. Ichiban in the next block over a short drive. More choices are not too far away up the I45 service road.

Hotel in the middle of renovation. The neighbor did not look safe. When I enter the building wow heavy construction in the lobby. Should have stopped doing business at least during the construction. When I reach the floor again there is a renovation you can smell chemicals could breathe.

The property is undergoing renovations and i should have been notified prior. Was extremely noisy. Jackhammers inside the lobby and saws cutting tile all day for my 4 nights. Dusty and smelled of sewer as well. Quite unpleasant and I would not stay there again or possibly use Expedia as you should have mentioned the condition and noise. Was n’t able to have planned meetings in the lobby and had to rent a car and leave for quiet.

Fantastic Staff rooms 7 venue to hold an event. My staff and I both stayed at the hotel and hosted a 3 day event. Diane Hohman was my contact person in both setting up the contract and setup of our show. She was fantastic. Made me feel very welcome and appreciated from the first time I heard from her. She was extremely accommodating as well in all our needs and even checked in with us on her days off. We also worked with Geof Hakemack who was wonderful to work with as well. We devised some planning together to maximize the event to its full capacity and it was a very successful event. We felt welcomed by all staff members and plan to hold future events at this venue as well. The rooms were also very comfortable and clean and newly renovated. They have refrigerators as well in the room along with a safe. Very nice hotel and setup. They were renovating the lobby yet it was still attractive and well maintained.
